resposta: The French and Indian War started in 1754.
In 1756, Great Britain declared war on France.
Approximately 60,000 settlers in the French colonies and 2 million in British colonies.
French and British colonists had populations of approximately 4.3 million (法国) and 59 million (英国), respectively.
The French and Indian War was a theater of the Seven Years' War, which pitted the North American colonies of the British Empire against those of France.
By treaty, France agreed with Britain to end 18th-century European conflicts in exchange for territorial gains.
The Battle of Jumonville Glen occurred during the French and Indian War.
The British captured Fort Beauséjour during their campaign against French Canada.
The final treaty with France was reached by 1763, leading to the end of the Seven Years' War in North America.
